title: Oliver Gildart proud of Great Britain team-mate Zak Hardaker's transformation: 'It's been great to see him get his head screwed back on'
text:
Much has been made of Zak Hardaker changing his ways this season, not least by the player himself, but Oliver Gildart is as well qualified as anyone to detail his Wigan team-mate's dramatic transformation.

Gildart announced himself on the international stage with a stunning long-range try on his England debut in last year’s opening Test series victory over New Zealand in Hull.

He has since earned a call into Wayne Bennett’s Great Britain squad as the Lions return after a 12-year absence with a four-match tour of New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

Gildart is poised to start against Tonga in Hamilton on Saturday and form a centre partnership with Hardaker, whose debut season at Wigan began with a drink-driving charge and ended with a Great Britain call-up.

“Zak and I have become really good friends this year,” said Gildart, a Wiganer who came through the ranks at his hometown club.

“We travel to training together every day at Wigan and he’s been through a lot.

“It’s been great to see him get his head screwed back on and do what he does best by playing some good rugby this year.”

Hardaker last week spoke with searing honesty about his previous drinking habits, which included a three-day binge following his last England appearance in May 2017.
